website_summaries.verdict: The BenQ W1070 3D home entertainment projector offers high-quality 1080p video that's bright enough to stand up to ambient light, but it shows rainbow artifacts relatively easily.
pros: Works directly with HDMI 1.4a devices like Blu-ray players and cable TV for full 1080p 3D
cons: Doesn't work with 120Hz DLP-link glasses for 3D

customer_reviews.title: Good HD projector
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this projector in December of 2014. It was a very good projector been using it for 5 and 1/2 years. After approximately a year-and-a-half of usage, it stopped working. I contacted BenQ they determined it was under warranty they paid to have it shipped, repaired it, and returned to me. I am Still using the original bulb.. Recently I just bought an upgraded BenQ 4K projector to replace it with. Since it is still working well, I gave my son-in-law this projector
customer_reviews.author: KM59

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I have had this projector now since 2014. It has been in a dedicated light controlled media room and has consistently produced awesome images crisp and clean on a 120" screen with a relatively short throw distance. This sucker has been amazing with only 1 lamp replacement. (which was super easy to do and not overly expensive. Overall... For the price... This one can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: C.T.

customer_reviews.title: this projector is amazing. I am a quality nut used to Plasma/OLED ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this projector is amazing. I am a quality nut used to Plasma/OLED contrast and deep blacks and this still impressed me. I also have A/V experience with other much more expensive projectors and this one measures up to those in the $1,500 to $2,000 range. I think this is one of those products that is mispriced. You get way more for your money than other projectors in the same arena.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonSlime

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This is the first projector I've ever purchased but seems like a great projector. 1080p looks great. Speaker is really loud but not much else so I recommend getting a speaker system.I'm using speaker on level one in a 13x16 room and it's plenty loud. I looked hard at the view sonic and the optoma but ultimately decided on the benq. Brightness is pretty good even when all lights are on as shown in my images. Best setup is in completely dark room. Overall pretty good value being able to get a 100"-120" HD screen for under $1000. Will see how long the lamp lasts since i hear they are pretty pricey to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Hitman

customer_reviews.title: Was caught on fire and still work!!! (My fault)
customer_reviews.text: Awesome projector. Used on a daily bases and bulb still works just fine. Looks great during day light and I have a very well light living room with big windows. I tried dusting it one day with a air dust can and the projector was on. A lit but of moister got inside of it and it caught on fire. Not the smartest move on my part but I paniced and through it on the ground and but out the fire with a blanket. lol later I reconnected it and it worked just fine. I was really impressed by this.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: We love our BenQ W1070
customer_reviews.text: We love our BenQ W1070. Using the projector on a 120-inch white screen in our new movie room and it is just great. There are a lot of helpful features in the settings to help get your screen lined up perfectly. The remote is back-lit and can be activated with a push of a button which is very handy if you need to control the projector in a dim room. We have used this projector for a few hours a day for about 3 months now with 0 issues. The fan is more quite than I was expecting so that was a pleasant surprise. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Drake L.

customer_reviews.title: Lamp exploded with less than 1000 hours of use.
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality was good while it lasted. After a little over a year of sparing use (less than 600 hours of use), the lamp exploded. BenQ customer service would not do anything to help, other than to suggest taking it to an electronic shop to clean out the broken glass and install a new lamp. Now, to get it back up and running, I will have to shell out 250$ for a new lamp and housing, and whatever additional cost to have the inside of the projector cleaned. So, for a little over a year of use, I am upwards of a 1000$ for this item. I am regretting moving from a wall mounted TV to a BenQ projector.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: I've been extremely happy with the simplicity
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for light-duty home cinema viewing that I can set up and tear down quickly. I've been extremely happy with the simplicity, the picture quality, and the overall value. After a couple of years in use, the fan started acting up, resulting in the projector overheating and shutting down. I researched and found this was a common problem. When I reached out to Ben Q, they repaired this for free even though the unit was out of warranty. This is a testament to the company standing behind its products and customers, and I'll do business with them again.
customer_reviews.author: L. Clator Butler Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps shutting down.
customer_reviews.text: The only problem with this unit is the constant over heating and subsequent shutdown. We've checked the internal fans and they seem to be working still it shuts down after 7-10 minutes of operation. We put a small room fan to blow into it to extend the time but lately even that has failed. There are 2553 hours on the bulb. We chose this model after reading the reviews. We like the projector format and will get another one but better research will precede the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dee N

customer_reviews.title: and really couldn't be more satisfied. We're using this primarily for nighttime rooftop viewings ...
customer_reviews.text: Just received this projector last week, and really couldn't be more satisfied. We're using this primarily for nighttime rooftop viewings and it's basically perfect. I can say that this definitely won't hold up in direct sunlight, but that's not really what it's designed to do. We did a test in our living room as well, which has large windows, and you could still see the picture very clearly. For video games, it seems like there is no input lag whatsoever, even in faster paced games everything holds up nicely. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
customer_reviews.author: Dan B.

customer_reviews.title: Great picture
customer_reviews.text: the Projector I replaced was ceiling mounted in the back of the room about 40 feet from the screen. I did not realize the some projectors only "throw" a certain distance. Most newer projectors like this one can only be mounted about 20 feet or some from the screen, otherwise it gets blown up way too big. I had to buy a new mount to hang this out in the middle of the ceiling. Other than that, the picture is great. It is comparibale the the DLP tv I have upstairs. Very bright HD picture. Obviously looks best in a dark setting, but still looks good during the day with sunlight coming in through the windows.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby B

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up! Recommend this product...
customer_reviews.text: I would have given 5 star but the picture sharpness is not as good as Optma HD25e. I'm yet to try out the 3D feature but overall it is good projector. Here are the Pros and Cons. Pros - The throw distance is good - Easy to set-up & Easy configuration - Provides better flexibility of placement Cons - Rainbow effect (not highly noticeable) - Sharpness of the picture (low compared to Optma HD25e) The BenQ W1070 3D home entertainment projector offers high-quality 1080p video that's bright enough to stand up to ambient light, but it shows rainbow artifacts relatively easily. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nra

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a week, only a few hours of usage
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice, when it works(ed). I got this last week, and after three days of use it no longer works. It's on a table top unobstructed and the room temperature is 70, but after last than half an hour of usage it seems to overheat and turn off. The power and temp lights are red after this. I'm not very happy that its doing this at moderate temperatures. :(
customer_reviews.author: Jared Lapierre

customer_reviews.title: Very good for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Very good for gaming. Have it hooked up to my PC for fighting and couch coop games. Looks beautiful, and has good color even in ambient light conditions. There are forums for color correction with this model. The fan is a little loud in high alititude situations, looks simple to open and swap out for a nice Noctua. Just uses an 80mm PC fan.
customer_reviews.author: B. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Oh my, how far projectors have come
customer_reviews.text: Seriously excellent - especially for the price. Cannot go wrong with this unit and I have had (and still do have) a few really good projectors to compare it to. While not a light cannon like my Panny 8000, it is much more than adequate for our purposes and for the price I'm amazed. Great, consistent, and uniform light output, crisp detail, and no discernible lag when playing Xbox 360 and iRacing on PC. Hated to replace my old Epson Tw100, but this unit outdoes everything about that unit for an absurdly low price (in comparison when new). Will recommend to anyone looking for a 100+" screen for any light-controlled environment.
customer_reviews.author: Scoob Edoo

customer_reviews.title: Game changer - I love it.
customer_reviews.text: Projector technology has come a long way since my last one. It used to be size is king, but that's not the case anymore. I use this for both gaming (PS4) and movies and it excels at both. My previous setup was a 46" 1080P 120Hz Samsung LCD, and I do not miss it at all. Everyone that has stopped by loves it and is genuinely surprised it's a projector. It's very important you have the ability to control the ambient light in the room as this isn't the brightest bulb out there. I paired an Elite Screens and Polk Audio sound bar to go with this and I could not be more happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Boomshackla

customer_reviews.title: Best in class
customer_reviews.text: Best projector I could find at the budget I had. We are very happy with it after almost a year now. Even with moderate light the picture is decent and watchable. Once it gets dark the picture is amazing!! Also, gaming is unbelievable and I haven't noticed any lag.(call of duty games). If you're on a budget and want to watch 3D movies, I recommend buying the SainSonic SSZ-200DLB glasses. I'm projecting it onto a 100" electric Elite screen in a small living room.
customer_reviews.author: Simply eat play live

customer_reviews.title: Good, but then bad
customer_reviews.text: I liked this projector for the first two years, but now it won't even get through a two hour movie without suddenly shutting down with a red TEMP light on. Then, when the power button is pressed again, the LAMP light light will flash while starting and it will work for maybe another hour before it starts again. Now I come here and read a bunch of similar complaints posted just days before this happened to my unit. Strange.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bro

customer_reviews.title: The bulb only lasted 4800 hours instead of 10,000 as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The projector is great and the picture looks amazing on our 18' screen. However, after three years and only 4800 hours the bulb exploded like a gun shot. The description says it should last 10,000 hours. It was a mess to clean up and I had to take apart the entire projector to clean out all of the glass since a piece got stuck under the lamp cooling fan.
customer_reviews.author: srfarmer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful picture quality
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak much for the technology because that's over my head but after researching reviews this projector looked like the best deal for the dollar and I am so happy I went with this model. Straight out of the box we had no problems getting it running. We have a large outdoor projector screen and it has no problems displaying a crisp, clear picture on it. We're so very happy with the picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nancie Quinton

customer_reviews.title: Great for high school movie night.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. We installed it in our basement rec room. We have it set to project a 14' diagonal picture using our PS3 and a low end Boston Acoustics sound bar/sub woofer. Perfect for movie night for a dozen teenagers. The picture is very good projected on a lightly textured white wall. The only issue is the brightness, we need to have the lights turned low to see the picture clearly. This isn't an issue for our use but if you want to watch in a well lit room, your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: M. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: We have been installing projector s for thirty years and NEVER experienced an image this good for this price
customer_reviews.text: UNREAL image for the price! We have been installing projector s for thirty years and NEVER experienced an image this good for this price. Sure a $10k projector will look better but....this outperforms anything under that in the 1080p category. On a 120" 16:9 1.1 gain screen this little unit produces an image so bright and clear it is watchable with ambient light. There is NO reason to spend one penny more to get a great picture. No motion artifacts, no rainbow, only an outstanding image. Much credit to BenQ for getting this right.
customer_reviews.author: THX Designer

customer_reviews.title: All I can say is wow!
customer_reviews.text: I have been researching and looking for months for a projector. Going back and forth between used, new, different brands or just a new TV. All I can say is this little beauty knocked my families sock off just 1 minute into playing our first DVD. Simply amazing. The crispness, color, darks, smoothness of the picture. All absolutely great. It is a bit in my book. I also bought a portable screen as we will be using it for outdoor movies as well, 92 inch on the diagonal. The picture was awesome. I can't wait to try it on my wall to see if I can get the 19 foot diagonal picture. Will keep you posted.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Terrific performance in dark conditions, no surprise that the black levels aren't great with ambient light.
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoy this projector. It is sitting in my basement at 106". I have two large windows nearby and routinely watch the TV during the day. If you watch it with lights on or windows exposed, do not expect great (or even mediocre) black level performance. Your room will need to be pretty dark for that. I will say that watching sports or anything that doesn't require black level performance is totally fine in eco mode during the day. When the room is dark, the projector works very well with all situations. Black levels still aren't terrific, but for this price level I am extremely happy with the overall performance.
customer_reviews.author: Matt L

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: I'm no expert, but I did check out every review I could find for a projector before buying one. Pretty much every expert site said this is *the* projector for entry level home theater set ups. So far I'm happy with it. The picture is bright enough, and sharp enough to give me a good experience with a 110 inch screen. I'd say the remote is very basic, and seems like its from 2001, but I kind of prefer that. It does get warm i'd say the feet are not easy to adjust for getting a level picture - but I have mine ceiling mounted.
customer_reviews.author: gman

customer_reviews.title: ... had this for about nine months now and I love it. I painted my wall white and just ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about nine months now and I love it. I painted my wall white and just use the wall instead of an actual screen and it looks great. I was worried that the projector would be too noisy since I have it about five feet above my head, but it makes almost no sound. The 3D image is a little darker than I would like, but there's really nothing that can be done about that - it's just a drawback to the 3D glasses. For the price of this projector, the image is certainly acceptable and I don't really watch that much 3D anyway. In a dark room, it's not really an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: I was able to free up a lot of room in my living room by getting rid of my old LCD tv & upgrading to a projector. I decided on the BenQ W1070 after reading all about projectors & their reviews on Amazon; it's basically the best projector for the money hands down. My only complaint is the lens cover is just a piece of plastic on a string & my friend has a similar projector that has an automatic open/close lens cover, but even still, my overall picture just looks better than hers so I think I made the right decision.
customer_reviews.author: DRP

customer_reviews.title: After a couple weeks of use I have to say this projector is fantastic. Picture is as clear as any flat screen
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after a lot of product research. After a couple weeks of use I have to say this projector is fantastic. Picture is as clear as any flat screen. I'm projecting a 135 inch picture. Great for sports and movies. The old 50 inch flat screen now looks puny. Update, I cannot say enough about the customer service from BenQ. My projector started overheating due to a faulty fan. A quick phone call, and completion of a simple form over email, and my unit was sent from the east coast to the west coast, repaired and back home in 1.5 weeks. All at no cost and with NO HASSLES. I will definitely buy another BenQ when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Easy

customer_reviews.title: Our own movie theater in the house.
customer_reviews.text: This projector works great. The quality is perfect with our HD cable service. We decided to do a home theater projection set up as opposed to getting a huge flat screen. With this projector we spent less than $700 bucks. The quality is perfect with our HD cable service. We love watching the Bruins games and we love having family movie night. We watched this past 2015 Superbowl with this and it was great. Its like having our own little movie theater in the house.
customer_reviews.author: FlanNH

customer_reviews.title: Loved it till it quit working
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about two months. The first two months were great but now it's developed a terrible picture that looks a little like looking at a computer screen in 16 bit colors or with bad video drivers. I've tried different HDMI cables, ever setting on the remote, different input sources and they all now look low quality. Unfortunately the return period was up about a month ago, so I'm wondering how I can get it repaired or replaced. I loved it before the video quality deteriorated. Is there a way to update the video drivers???
customer_reviews.author: Mike'sRatings

customer_reviews.title: Great projector for the price
customer_reviews.text: I ham a ham handed clutz and broke my Optoma HD 20, when trying to clean it and fix the color wheel. So, I decided to switch to the Ben Q. I must say, it is a great projector! Really pleased with it. I did not calibrate, just used the out of the box settings. The on board speakers are useless in a home theater setting, but would help if this projector was used for business presentations. I bought some 3D glasses and am hooked on the 3D. Very easily syncs with the glasses and the movies look great. Would highly recommend this projector. Overall, the picture quality is an upgrade from my Optoma HD 20.
customer_reviews.author: J. Reihl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect projector for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this projector for a home theater room I was installing. Debated between this one and a ViewSonic around the same price. I am running on a110" elite screen and couldn't be happier with the quality of image this projector produces.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: BenQ  3D 1080p
customer_reviews.text: I have had this projector for a couple of months, the picture quality is really great, crisp, and the colors come to live in 3D. I have another 1080p projector, and this BenQ has blown it out of the park, as far as picture quality. The speaker that comes with it is ok, just not very loud, which I don't use anyways, I use the surround sound system that I already had. I also bought the shutter glasses SainSonic Rainbow Series Black 144hz 3D for 20 bucks...on amazon. Movie Nite out doors is awesome with family and friends.update... still using this projector, for gaming and movies still using the same bulb that cane with it. Still very satisfied!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lee Riddell

customer_reviews.title: Best projector buy for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I was doing research on a projector to replace the one we use to go over our financials and designs with customers, and this one was one of the most highly suggested. For under $1000, you cannot beat this projector. I have used several projectors that are double this cost that do not have near the clarity or brightness. Full 1080P display, crystal clear and can be bright enough to see in a well lit room! Not much more you could ask for.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: I was blown away by how good this is
customer_reviews.text: This was my first projector and so, while I am no expert by any means, I was blown away by how good this is. I had done quite a lot of research, using many of the well known, online fora, as well as real product reviews and these led me to believe that this was the safest way to spend $700 on a projector. I see that the price for the replacement, the HT1085, has reduced somewhat, so that might make that a little more enticing, but if you still want to save over $100, then its hard not to recommend the W1070.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Sensible

customer_reviews.title: Great projector. Bad remote.
customer_reviews.text: Projector is great. Remote quit working. I have had it for awhile, but I've never had any other remote I own just quit working. Otherwise, 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew B Gandy

customer_reviews.title: Definitely the "Best bang for your buck" projector system out there. Very Happy.
customer_reviews.text: This projector has a crisp picture with great sound even without an additional sound system. Great for movies and gaming. Easy setup and installation. Spend the extra money on this projector, you will not be disappointed. I am going to add a 5.1 surround sound satellite speaker system soon, but it really isn't needed if you are on a budget. Was truly amazed at the quality of the picture even though the wall i projected this on is a dirty white color with a bad texture in a room that has quite a bit of ambient light. Cant even tell the texture is there and the projector over powers the dirtiness and ambient light.
customer_reviews.author: Cole Ibendahl

customer_reviews.title: Pretty easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: First projector, so I am just learning. I spent a lot of time researching this and the similiarly priced Optima. Projector Central gave this unit the nod in this price range so I went for it. Pretty easy to setup. Picture quality is great in certain circumstances, and not so great in others. I see a lot digital noise in darker scenes and whites sometimes get washed in bright scene. So I go back and forth between a state of awe and a state of...eh. But I dont know what I dont know, continuing to tweak. But I think its a keeper
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and love it. I mounted it to the ceiling using ...
customer_reviews.text: We've had the projector for 2 weeks now, and love it. I mounted it to the ceiling using a BenQ $60 mount, and it is solid. (The mount was probably overkill, since this projector really doesn't weigh much) We have the projector connected to a Yamaha TSR-675 receiver, and it works great. We are projecting it onto a 110" screen in our basement. The picture is super bright - even with the lights on. No complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Great projector in this price range.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, for this price range, this one gets a solid A. Sure, there's better out there, but for a price. For our near-totally blacked out, no windows, purpose built home-theater/video game room, this projector is fantastic. Pretty quiet, too. Light bleed from vents is a bit distracting at times, but only if I'm really looking for it. I only wish they still made it...we may need another, the short throw version, to replace in our workout room.
customer_reviews.author: TroyTali

customer_reviews.title: Excellent projector
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is very good. Works very well in medium lighted room. 3D picture is excellent (depends on the 3D DVD quality also). I am using pro grey projector screen fabric pasted on wall directly and made border with black felt tape, both sold by carls place on amazon. This projector produces very good picture for price. Built in sound is fine but a good home theater system with 3D capability is a must.
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: Love this projector
customer_reviews.text: Love this projector. A concern one may have is will it be bright enough or how dark does my room have to be. I find at times needing to leave a light on in the room because it is so bright. Everyone who sees it is quite impressed with how clear and sharp the picture is on the screen. I projected onto a 80 inch screen but would love to see what it would do on a screen much larger. Make sure you have enough room to get some distance between you and the screen otherwise it will blind you. Do your research but I don't feel you be disappointed with this projector.
customer_reviews.author: Donald24433

customer_reviews.title: GAMING REVIEW
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with this projector im displaying an 80 inch screen from around 7 to 8 feet away, very easy to setup looks great out of the box. I use it for movies and playing pc games, i play very fast pace games like battlefield 4 i notice no lag at all feels more responsive than my last tv actually. my only con is that it runs pretty warm and blows out hot air. Not really a problem for me though Still highly recommend 3D: looks amazing i also played games 3D and its just jaw dropping.best investment ive made
customer_reviews.author: IIVIIATT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I can't say much more than has already been said. It's not quite as dominate in the value market as it was a year ago, but this is still a very, very good projector. I use it every day as my TV and PC monitor in the living room. I have about 1800hours on it and it's still plenty bright to use in the daytime with the curtains drawn. 3D is cool, but is a bit dark with the color settings I use. 3D gaming is too laggy to be playable, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: 4TheRide

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, stunning
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, stunning, brilliant and bright, flawless image! I have been researching projectors for months and after reading 1 rave review after another for this projector I pulled the trigger. Arrived yesterday and without a screen on the wall, just testing against a painted wall the picture, clarity, and vibrant colors are truly amazing. BenQ is competing with Projectors 4 & 5 times the cost. Great job, fast shipping, easy to use, literally haven't made any adjustments to the settings. Just plug and play .. enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Bone

customer_reviews.title: Great projector, probably best bang for you buck
customer_reviews.text: Great projector, probably best bang for you buck. Keep track of your bulb hours. So far I have only had to replace the bulb once. Only buy replacement bulbs from manufacturer, lots of third party scammers out there. Really have enjoyed this projector.
customer_reviews.author: Grumps

customer_reviews.title: The great reviews are true!
customer_reviews.text: The great reviews are true. I've been using this for about 8 weeks now and I've been really satisfied. The image looks great. For daytime use, it's brighter than I expected. Watching movies during the daytime has been fine as long as I have moderate curtain coverage over my windows. I project onto a Da-Lite 96x96 pull down screen. It's a nice combination for the money. The projector, in my opinion, is quiet. Previously I was using an Epson Powerlite 8345. I think performs just as well, maybe even brighter during the day.
customer_reviews.author: LAriver

customer_reviews.title: Best in its price class
customer_reviews.text: You won't find a better projector for this price. Years I had it, 3D is incredible, full HD. So many adjustments options. Color reproduction is amazing for its class. If you're worried about a bulb overheating, just TURN ON ALTITUDE MODE in options, that'll turbocharge the cooling fan.
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: My first projector. I dont if its because i ...
customer_reviews.text: My first projector. I dont if its because i had my expectations low but this thing blew me away instantly. I used it for the first time for the mayweather/pac fight and lets just say everyone i know wants to watch big sporting events at my house from now on. If i had to nitpick i would say that the black levels are a tad bit bright. But im comparing it to my panny plasma. Overall though my movie watching will be done on the projector from now on.
customer_reviews.author: jesus

customer_reviews.title: was not disappointed, would buy again even in 2016
customer_reviews.text: best projector ive ever owned did a LOT of research before buying it, at the time (april 2015) this was still the best bang for your buck the colors are AMAZING, its quiet, doesnt get too hot, and supports 3d. looks about as good as a midrange led tv, but i got 130 inches for under 800 bucks
customer_reviews.author: Ben Morse

customer_reviews.title: Excellent project for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent projector. My friend has panasonic A series which is really good but costs 3 times the BenQ, but for $700 this one is very close to high end projectors. It really amazes me with sharp pictures and great colors. I bought this after reading many good reviews in AMAZON and also many other external sites.
customer_reviews.author: Ish

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is this exceeded my expectations! Picture quality is great both in 2D and 3D. I'm using these glasses with  it. So far I have it projected it on a medium gray color wall and you can still see every little detail. I'm sure it will look better on my 110" screen once I get it done. Even the on board speaker is decent, but we all know that is not used in a home theater setup. Just a tip... It does blow out a lot of heat so make sure your not planning to enclose it in. It may overheat quicker.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel W.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PROJECTOR!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome projector!!! The image, clarity, brightness, are great! I just love what I see and I am a first time projector buyer. I'm using it against an Elite Screens Yard Master 2, 120" x 16:9 screen, and they are a great match up for indoors or outdoors. SUPER PLEASED!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S. Grove

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: OMFG this thing is fantastic. I also got the projector mount from the same company and they look great on the ceiling (though installation was pretty tough). This thing really is, as another reviewer said, a light cannon. We have it projecting an absolutely crystal clear image at over 100" diagonal in our living room.
customer_reviews.author: X. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: I love it—use it every day
customer_reviews.text: I love it—use it every day. Clear image, great color. Not much control over size of image; it's large. At 15 feet distance, the smallest width is 10 feet. But that is exactly right for me. I wish the keystone control had more options.
customer_reviews.author: RobertL

customer_reviews.title: Easily the best DLP projector under $1000
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best DLP projector under $1000. Its vibrant colors and incredible clarity are marred only by soft black levels. This model supports a host of inputs, including many legacy types (such as VGA, component, and S-video), and does a good job in scaling anything under 1080p (which it natively supports). With 3D capability and a relatively short throw distance, this DLP fits almost any home theater setup. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Stuart A. Oquin

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUT DO NOT BUY FOR THE LENS CONTRO
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS FOR THE LENS CONTROL, as it is minimal. You basically have to hang from ceiling at a specific distance or setup in front of your screen (say on your coffee table, where I have mine as my false ceiling won't hold projector). Image is very good, very, very bright as other reviews noted. A very good buy for the price point. I guess if it really had lens control, it would be over $1K.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Better than a TV
customer_reviews.text: Works well in all situations, ambient light is not an issue. The only thing I dislike about it is the onboard speakers, but I don't use them nor intend to anytime soon. Picture quality is superb even when projecting onto a wall surface, noise is minimal and nonexistent when watching movies. I would definitely buy it again and recommend it to anyone looking to replace their TV or set up an entertainment room.
customer_reviews.author: Shakyra

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: There is a light leak on the left side of the device itself. The contrast isn't as high as I'd like either. Sometimes, things look too bright, especially glowing items in video games. However, I'm happy with the brightness and the ability to watch it during the day and night. I miss having the optical output for audio, but I'm still good with the 3.5mm headphone jack that it has. I would buy this again, for the price ($750).
customer_reviews.author: P.Norris

customer_reviews.title: Great !!!
customer_reviews.text: Just set up the projector. It works great !!! large bright clear picture, better that what I expected. 3D is GREAT !!! It's brand new so I cant speak about longevity. Easy to connect, straight forward cd with instructions. It was exactly what I was looking for. Update 2+ yrs after purchase....projector is fantastic !!! replaced original bulb at approx 4400 hrs. (we use it a lot , home theater room)...Installed Bare bulb for about 75 dollars, easy install, good as new...Still love this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Carl T.

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice projector. we have had it for a year ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice projector. we have had it for a year now, and it has not had any problem. we have tried it with HDMI cable to laptop, HDMI cable to Raspberry Pie and recently with Amazon Fire stick and they all work like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: shifox

customer_reviews.title: Nice projector with small footprint
customer_reviews.text: Nice projector with small footprint. Replaced larger Epson projector with this one. Good 3D too (glasses NOT included!). Decent brightness, room should be darkened though for best clarity. I was surprised about the screen size that this one produces even at close distance. I needed to upgrade my 96 inch screen to a 150 inch screen in my existing setup so that i didn't have to move the projector ceiling mount and cabling a few feet closer.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Blum

customer_reviews.title: Could not be happier with this thing
customer_reviews.text: You may be a little bit skeptical about the picture quality of this projector because of the price compared to more expensive models; or at least I was before I bought it. Could not be happier with this thing, the picture is crisp and clear. We have used this a few times along with a 12' inflatable screen in the backyard for movie nights outside, the picture is so dang clear. Standing 40-50 feet away from the screen, this thing looks like your watching an HD channel on a tv inside. Nice projector that will be used in a home theater as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jojks

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Gaming Projector
customer_reviews.text: This projector is amazing for the price. My wife couldn't believe the picture for such a low cost. I paired it with the Elite Screens Sable Frame B2 Series, 100-inch Diagonal 16:9 and they work very well together. 100" 1080p setup for under $1000 can't be beat. Plus the lag times for gaming are excellent. Black Ops III is taken to a whole new level.
customer_reviews.author: purdueboiler91

customer_reviews.title: I've enjoyed the theater quality of a 110 inch screen and ...
customer_reviews.text: 'Binky' as we call it, produces a picture so clean and clear that you feel as if you're in the scene. I've enjoyed the theater quality of a 110 inch screen and a Panasonic AE 2000 projector for the last 8 years. Now that I've seen what Binky can do I am reviewing all my old movies and seeing things I'd never noticed before. I would recommend this projector without reservation. The high quality I enjoyed in the past has been surpassed by this little projector. Buy it, you'll like it.
customer_reviews.author: M Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Great price. Amazon Global did a hassle free delivery ...
customer_reviews.text: Would have given it higher than 5 stars if possible. Great price. Amazon Global did a hassle free delivery to India. Had all measurements for setting up pre-done with the BenQ online calculator - which proved to be dead accurate in the real world. Colours and 3D reproduction are fantastic. Slight rainbow effect when displaying high contrast black and white - read; only noticed during movie credits. I do not see the rainbow effect otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Anurup Mitra

customer_reviews.title: Quality of the picture is good however its annoying to restart it when we are ...
customer_reviews.text: i bought a year over however haven't opened it until recently as my media room setup wasn't done. After the setup, starting using the projector couple of hours per week and started seeing the projector turn off automatically every 15 min to 30 min depending you use continuously or giving a break. I googled for this and this seems to be persisting with no fix. I tried setting options, auto time shut off & sleep time to disable mode but still the issue is not resolved. Quality of the picture is good however its annoying to restart it when we are in middle of watching something. Not worth to buy this model.
customer_reviews.author: mohanpalla

customer_reviews.title: ... I think buying this BenQ projector is a very good call and with the discount during thanksgiving sale it ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first 3D HD projector and after reading everyone's review and the review in projector central site I think buying this BenQ projector is a very good call and with the discount during thanksgiving sale it is really worth the money. It's been a month or so and watching the 3D Avatar and other movies, on a 10' screen with projector 14' from screen is awesome. I don't know enough to write all technical details, but I don't have to, just go to projector central site its all there. Great product, high quality picture, easy to setup and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Rkar

customer_reviews.title: ... first but it has turned out to be a great purchase. I am watching this on a 120" ...
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I was a little skeptical about this projector at first but it has turned out to be a great purchase. I am watching this on a 120" SI black diamond screen and it looks fantastic. The picture is crisp and the colors look great. The fan is a little loud but once the surround sound kicks in, you cant notice a thing. Definitely glad I pulled the trigger and got this projector. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: thebrad00

customer_reviews.title: Lamp life too short!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good projector, until the lamp broke. The life of the lamp is a joke (reason for 2 stars). It exploded in the projector after 1300 hrs usage. I set it to Eco mode and always waited for it to cool down to shut off. The life span is far shorter than they state.
customer_reviews.author: eggtea

customer_reviews.title: Awesome projector!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this projector now for for about 3 years and I still love this thing. For 2 years I used it as my main TV and only just recently had to replace the bulb. The bulb wasn't even actually bad but it was way past the manufacturers time so I didn't want to take a chance that it would finally burn out during a party I was having. This is a great buy! The screen is really bright and the picture quality is outstanding!
customer_reviews.author: James Bynum

customer_reviews.title: Seems too good to be true. Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be more pleased with this product. The image is super sharp at 100" standing 7' away, and it's bright enough to have excellent contrast with non-blackout blinds pulled down during the day. It's also pretty small, and won't be too obnoxious mounted on my 8' ceiling. The only minor complained is the fan sounds a little rough, like it's going to break eventually, but I'll assume it's fine until it gets worse.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Super Bright
customer_reviews.text: I watched Matrix 3 as i set this up and the beginning scene after the all the green text turns to a brilliant yellow/whit light, it was almost blinding. color is very vivid and crisp. I purchased the BenQ 3D glasses and will be testing those out soon. ok so i tested out the 3D using the BenQ 3d glasses. I watched Dredd and it looked awesome. My brother bought the monster universal 3D glasses and they did not work. we could not get them to sync.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great projector. Do not buy the smart guard protection ...
customer_reviews.text: Great projector. Do not buy the smart guard protection plan. I bought it to cover the bulb and they would not cover it. They say that is a not protected as it is a consumer replacement part. Very shady company, avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Alex M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: We have owned one for 3.5 years and have used it daily. Just replaced the bulb last month and still looks great. Will buy another if this one ever dies.
customer_reviews.author: sandra stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Long bulb life and clear picture
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this projector for several years now and after a few thousand hours the bulb finally went out.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Miller

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this unit
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this unit, the picture quality is great, So far I have had no rainbow problems. The only con was the distance instructions are only in millimeters, so make sure you understand the true distance as this is a short throw projector. I would have liked to do a wall mount but at 17ft distance to screen was not feasible. Finding a ceiling mount with 70" extension for my vaulted ceiling was a slight problem and no attic to route cables, so some sheet rock work and paint but worth every effort in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WOW - What A Great Picture
customer_reviews.text: WOW – What a picture. I have been looking for a good quality projector that would produce a large, crisp, clean image. I was willing to spend $3k to $5k but after reading all of the reviews I thought I would give the BenQ a try. I’m glad I did. The picture is incredible. I’m using it in a Tavern that I own and everybody that comes in comments on how great it looks. This is a great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: TMcCann

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Home Projector
customer_reviews.text: I got this projector six months ago and use it nearly every evening. I am quite picky about color and image settings and found this easy to set up like I want it. It allows multiple settings (User 1, User 2.. ) for each source (HDMI 1, HDMI 2, S-Video, PC...) For instance I use different settings for playing DVDs and Blu-Ray discs in the Blu-Ray player. I definitely get better image quiality than with my previous two projectors (which were also DLP) and it throws less heat. It produces razor sharp images. My only complaint is that it is tricky to put on the lens cap without throwing the focus off for when you use it next.
customer_reviews.author: Dr D

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular Upgrade to my Home Theater!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace a Marantz unit that needed to move on... (It was ~7 years old, and only 720p) This unit is so much: -Brighter -Sharper -So Much Easier to setup -Quieter I do hear the fans a little bit when there is no audio, but not enough to be distracting. I should have ordered it a long time ago.. I had no idea what I was missing!
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Great seller
customer_reviews.text: Really happy. Been using this for a while and it hasn’t disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Dario

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: We used the projector very rarely, like maybe once/weekend on movie nights. After about 2-3 years of the limited use, the projector stopped working and BenQ asked us to send it back to them to check and get a quote on repairs as we were out of warranty. Painful and waste of $$$ experience for the projector to die on minimal use.
customer_reviews.author: Smitha

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic quality. Has lasted a really long time and the 3d is amazing
customer_reviews.author: Celeste G.

customer_reviews.title: No better projector value exists.
customer_reviews.text: After using it for about a year, the picture is holding up, but there appears to be dust/debris leaking into the lens cavity, as now there are subtle little spot blooms across the picture (while on a black screen) and bleeding light beyond the frame. I'm nitpicking here, as it's only barely detectable in a pitch-black room and black screen. Also, black detail is a bit lacking. But color is amazing, and picture continues to be very bright even after a year of pretty heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: RE Mogul

customer_reviews.title: ... for about a week and so far its been great. I'm projecting to a 110" silver ticket screen ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had the projector set up for about a week and so far its been great. I'm projecting to a 110" silver ticket screen and the image looks great. Anything below 1080P begins to look at little pixelated but its ok. Noise is not an issue even with low volume and projector is mounted right above me. for the price you can't go wrong with this projector.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo Bonilla

customer_reviews.title: Good Picture Quality
customer_reviews.text: Working great. Colors and picture quality is great. I purchased a $20 hard case at walmart but saw some high quality ones at harbor freight. Would recommend some hard case if you move it around a lot. The plastic foot to raise and lower the angle could be made better. It seems like it could break off easily. This is my first projector and I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It may not be cheap, but it shows. The picture quality is fantastic, and it's so bright I can clearly make out movies when the room is full of sunlight. I'm throwing the image against a wall that isn't very close to white, and it has no impact on the colors! I was very pleasantly surprised by that, as I don't have a good way to set up and store a screen.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hills

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this projector to replace my Optoma HD20 after a month of scouring projector reviews. I cannot believe the difference in brightness and picture quality. I also picked up a couple of sets of the "SainSonic Rainbow Series Black 144 Hz 3D Active Rechargeable Shutter Glasses for 3D DLP-Link Projectors and HDTV" from the SainStore and watched avatar last night in 3D and it was spectacular. Couldn't be happier with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Collins

customer_reviews.title: awesome projector
customer_reviews.text: This projector is completely awesome. It has unbelievable picture quality and looks amazing. The picture rivals my plasma TV and we are talking 120 inches compared to 58 with the plasma. I am shooting it onto a painted wall and I am blown away with the quality. I was hell bent on getting a screen but now I don't know if I will bother. Can't even imagine how much better it can get.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Nanne

customer_reviews.title: Grade A Projector
customer_reviews.text: If you're considering a projector in this price range, this is the one to go for. I'm a little bit of a BenQ fanboy at this point; but that's only because I have not yet once been disappointed with one of their products. This projector is clear, the colors are vivid, and in my opinion beats out other projectors in this price range. That being said, definitely look at the other projectors in this price range. Look at the throw distance and determine what suits you best (ie, the room you'll be using it in) before you make a purchase. There's a lot of factors to look in regards to projectors.
customer_reviews.author: Garret Prenguber

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had the projector very long to comment on durability, but as far as performance goes, it blows me away! Paired with a Silver Ticket screen and it is just jaw dropping. I did a lot of research before the purchase and this is hands down the best projector for me under $1000. Very low input lag for gaming and brilliant picture and colors to match. Loving this so far!
customer_reviews.author: JediL1C1OUS

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier with this projector
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier with this projector. Installed it about 3 months ago with the BenQ universal ceiling mount that I also purchased on Amazon. I use it for everyday tv, movies, and gaming. I have it projecting onto a white painted wall and it looks great, however the wall needs too be extremely smooth so that you don't see "ghost" images in the picture. Even though it has a built in speaker, I definitely recommend using some type of surround sound/external speaker system.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressive machine!
customer_reviews.text: As good as the best reviews say that it is! The only quirk with this machine is that you must use a screwdriver to adjust the vertical lens shift. I don't know why Benq went backwards on this feature. Several years ago I owned the Benq w500 720p projector with vertical and horizontal lens shift . The shift was easily adjusted with levers. No screwdrivers necessary. What's up with that , BenQ? Im projecting my 3D source onto a 120 inch screen. Looks terrific. No more trips to overpriced movie theaters.
customer_reviews.author: NYCSmith

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome projector! I have this paired with a 92" Silver Ticket screen and I could not be happier!!! I was able to correct for the slight blue shift of the screen with the wide range of controls on the projector. If you are looking for a great cheap screen/projector combo you can not go wrong with this setup for under $800!!!
customer_reviews.author: Orcus Varuna

customer_reviews.title: First projector
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research online about which projector to install in my new media room. So many people claimed this one was a great option for the price. I have to agree after having it installed for 2 months now. It worked great for our Super Bowl party. I have it projected to a 118" screen. Great picture, I mostly use it for sports and some regular TV shows. Not a gamer, so I can't comment on how it would work in that scenario.
customer_reviews.author: tigermac

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Projector!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first projector that we've owned. I did a lot of research and this hit every need that I was looking for. It's perfect for our situation because we have a relatively short throwing range and it's still able to produce a large and clear picture. It's packed full of features that I don't need to get into here. For the price, it's hard to beat the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nick N. N.

customer_reviews.title: great projector
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this projector since December 7th. The picture quality is excellent. I had read about the rainbow effect, and I am very susceptible to it, but I would not take away stars for that. I have it hooked up to a roku 3, and an external hard drive with several 2d and 3d movies. I have it projected onto a bare beige wall, and the picture quality is such that i do not intend on purchasing a screen any time soon.
customer_reviews.author: Rogelio Cervantes Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it for the money
customer_reviews.text: I was beyond impressed by the quality of this projector. It is very bright and certainly capable of being used as a "living room" projector in addition to a light-controlled home theater/media room. We are using a 125" accoustically transaparent screen and we are very happy with the brightness and image quality. For $850, you really cannot beat this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful picture
customer_reviews.text: This is my first projector. I had DLP TVs up to 73" before and this is just as good in my opinion but the size makes all the difference. Yes size matters alot, when you watching a movie or Planet Earth, Connecting a PC etc.....At this price range, I wil get this, than ANY other TV. I Got a 'cheap' 106 screen and it is a pleasure to watch anything on it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Tony

customer_reviews.title: Simply Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after extensive research on what I wanted in my media room. I needed something small and quiet that could produce a large 1080p image in a tight space. For me the 3D was a bonus, and a awesome one at that. Projecting this onto a 135" Elite Screens projector screen, the combo is stunning. I simply cant recommend this projector highly enough, at this price point it is truly unreal.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

You'll be captivated by brilliant image performance featuring the native 1080p DarkChip3 DLP technology by Texas Instruments and a 10,000:1 contrast ration and 2,000 ANSI lumens of brightness. Built-in speakers and east set-up seal the deal on this user-friendly experience.

Includes SmartEco technology for energy conservation and auto standby mode to save energy and prolong lamp life; lasts up to 6,000 hours
Watch Full HD 1080p movies, TV shows and sports, or play action packed video games on screens up to 200 inches in diagonal in any room of the house
Built-in speakers are plug-and-play ready, only the power cord and video source connection are needed to prepare the viewing experience
